volsense_core.models.lstm_forecaster moduleÔÉÅ

class BaseLSTM(input_dim: int, hidden_dim: int = 128, num_layers: int = 3, dropout: float = 0.2, n_horizons: int = 1, use_layernorm: bool = True, use_attention: bool = True, feat_dropout_p: float = 0.1, residual_head: bool = True, output_activation: str = 'none')[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: Module

LSTM-based multi-horizon forecaster with optional self-attention and residual head.

Input: (B, W, F) where W=window, F=features Output: (B, H) where H=len(horizons)

forward(x: Tensor) → Tensor[source]ÔÉÅ

Forward pass through feature-dropout, LSTM, optional attention, and heads.

Parameters:

x (torch.Tensor) ‚Äì Input tensor of shape [B, W, F].

Returns:

Predictions of shape [B, H] (or [B] when H==1).

Return type:

torch.Tensor

class FeatureDropout(p: float = 0.1)[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: Module

Feature-wise dropout mask shared across time steps (stochastic feature erasing).

forward(x: Tensor) → Tensor[source]ÔÉÅ

Apply channel-wise dropout with a single mask per sample across time.

Parameters:

x (torch.Tensor) ‚Äì Input tensor of shape [B, W, F].

Returns:

Tensor with dropped channels, scaled by 1/(1-p) during training.

Return type:

torch.Tensor

class MultiVolDataset(df: DataFrame, cfg: TrainConfig, scaler: TorchStandardScaler = None)[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: Dataset

Windowed multi-horizon dataset for single- or multi-ticker realized vol data.

Expected columns in df:

[‚Äúdate‚Äù, ‚Äúticker‚Äù, <features‚Ä¶>, target_col]

Behavior:

  • Sorts by (ticker, date)

  • Standardizes features with StandardScaler (train fit, val transform)

  • Standardizes target using train set y_mean/y_std; reuses for val

  • Drops constant features to avoid StandardScaler NaNs

  • Builds rolling windows of length cfg.window with multi-horizon labels

class TrainConfig(window: int = 30, horizons: List[int] = None, val_start: str = None, target_col: str = 'realized_vol', extra_features: list[str] | None = None, batch_size: int = 128, epochs: int = 15, lr: float = 0.0005, weight_decay: float = 1e-05, device: str = 'cpu', dropout: float = 0.2, hidden_dim: int = 128, num_layers: int = 3, use_layernorm: bool = True, use_attention: bool = True, feat_dropout_p: float = 0.1, residual_head: bool = True, output_activation: str = 'none', num_workers: int = 0, pin_memory: bool = False)[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

Training configuration for BaseLSTM.

Parameters:

  • window (int) ‚Äì Rolling lookback window length (timesteps).

  • horizons (list[int]) ‚Äì Forecast horizons (e.g., [1, 5, 10]).

  • val_start (str) ‚Äì Validation set start date (inclusive, YYYY-MM-DD).

  • target_col (str) ‚Äì Target column name to predict.

  • extra_features (list[str], optional) ‚Äì Additional feature names beyond ‚Äòreturn‚Äô to include.

  • batch_size (int) ‚Äì Mini-batch size for DataLoader.

  • epochs (int) ‚Äì Number of training epochs.

  • lr (float) ‚Äì Learning rate.

  • weight_decay (float) ‚Äì L2 weight decay.

  • device (str) ‚Äì Compute device (‚Äòcpu‚Äô or ‚Äòcuda‚Äô).

  • dropout (float) ‚Äì Dropout probability used in model modules.

  • hidden_dim (int) ‚Äì LSTM hidden size.

  • num_layers (int) ‚Äì Number of stacked LSTM layers.

  • use_layernorm (bool) ‚Äì Whether to apply LayerNorm to LSTM outputs.

  • use_attention (bool) ‚Äì Whether to apply self-attention over LSTM outputs.

  • feat_dropout_p (float) ‚Äì Feature-wise dropout probability at input.

  • residual_head (bool) ‚Äì Whether to add a residual linear projection to outputs.

  • output_activation (str) ‚Äì Output activation (‚Äònone‚Äô | ‚Äòsoftplus‚Äô | ‚Äòrelu‚Äô).

  • num_workers (int) ‚Äì DataLoader workers.

  • pin_memory (bool) ‚Äì DataLoader pin_memory flag.

collate_with_dates(batch)[source]ÔÉÅ

Collate function that stacks tensors and keeps Python datetime objects as a list.

Parameters:

batch (list[tuple[torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor, pandas.Timestamp]]) ‚Äì Iterable of (X, y, date) triplets produced by the Dataset.

Returns:

Tuple of stacked tensors and a list of dates: (X_batch, y_batch, dates).

Return type:

tuple[torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor, list]

evaluate_baselstm(model: Module, loader: DataLoader, cfg: TrainConfig, device: str = 'cpu')[source]ÔÉÅ

Evaluate model on a DataLoader and return de-standardized arrays.

If cfg contains y_mean/y_std (set during training), both predictions and targets are transformed back to the original volatility scale.

Parameters:

  • model (torch.nn.Module) ‚Äì Trained PyTorch model to evaluate.

  • loader (torch.utils.data.DataLoader) ‚Äì DataLoader providing batches from the evaluation split.

  • cfg (TrainConfig) ‚Äì Training config containing target standardization stats.

  • device (str) ‚Äì Compute device for inference (‚Äòcpu‚Äô or ‚Äòcuda‚Äô).

Returns:

Tuple of (preds, actuals) each shaped (N, H).

Return type:

tuple[numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray]

train_baselstm(df: DataFrame, cfg: TrainConfig)[source]ÔÉÅ

Train the BaseLSTM model and return the model, history, and loaders.

Parameters:

  • df (pandas.DataFrame) ‚Äì Input feature DataFrame with required columns and target.

  • cfg (TrainConfig) ‚Äì Training configuration.

Returns:

Tuple (model, history, (train_loader, val_loader)).

Return type:

tuple[torch.nn.Module, dict[str, list[float]], tuple[torch.utils.data.DataLoader, torch.utils.data.DataLoader]]
